arm_group.description: the contralateral eye in the same patient

brief_summary.textblock:
The study was conducted to investigate how postural changes including sitting, supine, and
      LDP(lateral decubitus position) affect the IOP(intraocular pressure) of SO(silicone
      oil-filled eyes. In addition, this study compared the IOP changes between the SO-filled eyes
      and the fellow eyes in each body position.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Postural Changes on Intraocular Pressure in Silicone Oil-filled Eyes

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  patients who had a 23-gauge pars plana vitrectomy

          -  must be done with SO(silicone oil,5,000 centistrokes) endotamponade using the Accurus
             system (Alcon Laboratories, Inc, Hünenberg,Switzerland)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  previous history or presence of glaucoma or uveitis

          -  IOP of ≥24 mmHg

          -  use of any antiglaucoma agents

          -  narrow angles

          -  corneal abnormality or diseases that could affect IOP

          -  refractive error exceeding a spherical equivalent of 6 diopters.

facility.name: Department of Ophthalmology, School of Medicine, Kyungpook National University

primary_outcome.measure: Mean IOP(intraocular pressure) at each time point during the change in body position

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Department of Ophthalmology, School of Medicine, Kyungpook National University

secondary_outcome.measure: IOP(intraocular pressure)differences between the SO(silicone oil)-filled eye and the fellow eyes at each time point during the change in body position

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
